item.title: Ticket #1540 (Date format returned by wp_get_archives is not localizable) created
item.dc:creator: stephenju
item.description: When using wp_get_archives('type=monthly'), the date string format in the links is hard coded as "month year" not localizable.

item.title: Ticket #1539 (foreach($cats as $cat) in nested category function broke) created
item.dc:creator: technosailor
item.description: There is some kind of error regarding the admin function get_nested_categories() in admin-functions.php. On line 395, the function call to the same function is causing issues. When commenting this line, the problem goes away. But I don't have nested categories so I would imagine it would go away.

item.title: Ticket #1007 (do_action & arguments) closed
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
worksforme:

Don't think this is still an issue. Closing. Please reopen if needed.

item.title: Ticket #1485 (Don't use trailingslashed IRIs if the user doesn't prefer them) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description: Okay... all silent on the 2nd opinion front. I'll try to get a cleaned up patch for 1.6 SVN made soon.

item.title: Ticket #910 (Wordpress allows dots in prefix) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
Keywords, Milestone changed

Gotta make a patch for this.

item.title: Ticket #1508 (permalink clash postname and post_id) updated
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
We might have to just list what rewrite structures we're going to accept and which ones we won't (or can't, without making the code extremely complex.)

Reminder to self: create checkboxes of common, supported rewrite structures on Options => Permalinks and call the user-supplied permalink structure box "Custom (Advanced User s Only)" with a link to a Codex page discussing which structures will work and which won't.

item.title: Ticket #1475 (mysql errors--automagically changing preferences?) closed
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
worksforme:

No response on this... I'm just going to attribute it to a user-specific problem. Please reopen if you can provide more info.
